comments.creator: limi@mozilla.com
comments.text:
In bug 599735, we put the feed icon in the menus for the "Subscribe" menu entry.

However, we currently special-case OS X to not show the RSS icon. This menu is already filled with favicons, so the increased discoverability of having the RSS icon show — along with it actually explaining what "Subscribe" will do for people that use RSS — is a good reason to show it on OS X too.

Additionally, since they are in the same group, and to establish a stronger link between star = bookmark, we should include the bookmark star icon for the "Bookmark This Page" entry.

(part of a larger menu cleanup, btw — Faaborg is filing related bugs — but standalone and can be resolved without the other changes)

comments.text:
(In reply to comment #0)
> However, we currently special-case OS X to not show the RSS icon. This menu is
> already filled with favicons, so the increased discoverability of having the
> RSS icon show — along with it actually explaining what "Subscribe" will do for
> people that use RSS — is a good reason to show it on OS X too.

AFAIK, we can't remove/dim the icon when the menu item is disabled, due to platform limitations. Do you want us to add it unconditionally? A disabled menu item with an icon might look weird...

comments.text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> AFAIK, we can't remove/dim the icon when the menu item is disabled, due to
> platform limitations. Do you want us to add it unconditionally? A disabled menu
> item with an icon might look weird...

I think this is fine, you don't know what shade of orange/blue would be enabled/disabled anyway, so the text and the inability to select it becomes the main indicator in any case. Dimming of icons in isolation rarely works (unless you establish grayscale = disabled or similar).
